intro: Diasperus ramillosus, commonly known as the slender spurge, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and succulent, branched stems. The plant has a shallow root system, allowing it to thrive in sandy soils and withstand periods of drought. Its leaves are typically small, alternate, and covered in a fine layer of white hairs, which help reduce water loss. Diasperus ramillosus is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops.
